name: Hook
title: The [Hook](https://github.com/hook-lang/hook/) cheat sheet is a one-page reference sheet for the Hook programming language.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: The [Hook](https://github.com/hook-lang/hook/) cheat sheet is a one-page reference sheet for the Hook programming language.

cards.title: Introduction
cards.body:
• [GitHub](https://github.com/hook-lang/hook)
• [Playground](https://hook-lang.github.io/hook-playground)
• [Examples](https://github.com/hook-lang/hook/tree/main/examples)
• [VSCode Extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=fabiosvm.hook)

cards.title: What does Hook look like?
Hello%2C%20world!
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Aprintln('Hello%2C%20World!')%3B%0A%2F%2F%20Hello%2C%20World!%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AThe%20%60Hello%2C%20World!%60%20program%20in%20Hook.

cards.title: Installing with Homebrew
cards.body:
```text
brew tap hook-lang/hook
brew install hook
hook --help
```

The interpreter is available on [`Homebrew`](https://brew.sh).

cards.title: Installing on Windows
cards.body:
```text
cd %tmp%
curl -sSLO https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hook-lang/hook/main/scripts/install.bat
install
```

This is how you can install it on `Windows`.

cards.title: Basic Types
cards.body:
|          |           |
| -------- | :-------- |
| `Nil`    | `Bool`    |
| `Number` | `String`  |
| `Range`  | `Array`   |
| `Record` | `Closure` |

List of basic types.

cards.title: Bool
Numbers
cards.body:
```js
let x = 0;
let degree = 45; // integer number
let pi = 3.14; // floating-point number
```

Numbers can be integers or floating-point.

cards.title: Strings
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Alet%20empty%20%3D%20''%3B%0A%0Alet%20name%20%3D%20'John'%3B%0A%0Alet%20message%20%3D%20'Hello%2C%20%22John%22!'%3B%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AStrings%20can%20be%20single%20or%20double-quoted.

cards.title: Ranges
Arrays
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Alet%20fruits%20%3D%20%5B'apple'%2C%20'banana'%2C%20'cherry'%5D%3B%0A%0Aprintln(fruits)%3B%0A%2F%2F%20%5B%22apple%22%2C%20%22banana%22%2C%20%22cherry%22%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AArrays%20are%20a%20sequence%20of%20elements.

cards.title: Records
The **nil** value
cards.body:
```swift
let x = nil;
var y;
```

```js
println(x); // nil
println(y); // nil
```

`nil` is the absence of a value.

cards.title: Comments
Semi-colons
cards.body:
```js
println(1) ; println(2) ; println(3) ;
println(4) ; println(5)
; println(6) ;
;                                      // error: unexpected token `;`
```

Semi-colons are required and empty statements are not allowed.

cards.title: Reserved words
cards.body:
|         |          |            |         |
| ------- | :------- | :--------- | :------ |
| `as`    | `break`  | `continue` | `do`    |
| `else`  | `false`  | `fn`       | `for`   |
| `from`  | `if`     | `import`   | `in`    |
| `inout` | `let`    | `loop`     | `match` |
| `nil`   | `return` | `struct`   | `trait` |
| `true`  | `var`    | `while`    |         |

There are few reserved words.

cards.title: Identifiers
Variables
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Avar%20x%3B%20%2F%2F%20x%20contains%20nil%0Ax%20%3D%205%3B%20%2F%2F%20now%2C%20x%20contains%20a%20number%0Ax%20%3D%20'foo'%3B%20%2F%2F%20a%20string%0A%0Aprintln(x)%3B%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AValues%20have%20types%2C%20but%20variables%20don't.

cards.title: Immutable variables
cards.body:
```js
let x = 5;

x = 10; // error: cannot assign to immutable variable `x`

let y; // error: unexpected token `;`
```

Immutable variables must be initialized when declared.

cards.title: Scopes
Shadowing
Arithmetic
cards.body:
```js
println(5 + 10); // 15
println(5 - 10); // -5
println(5 * 10); // 50
println(5 / 10); // 0.5
println(5 % 10); // 5
println(-5); // -5
```

The basic arithmetic operators.

cards.title: Comparison
cards.body:
```js
println(5 == 10); // false
println(5 != 10); // true
println(5 < 10); // true
println(5 > 10); // false
println(5 <= 10); // true
println(5 >= 10); // false
```

The comparison operators.

cards.title: Logical
cards.body:
```js
println(true && false); // false
println(true || false); // true
println(!true); // false
```

The logical operators.

cards.title: Bitwise and shift
cards.body:
```js
println(5 & 10); // 0
println(5 | 10); // 15
println(5 ^ 10); // 15
println(~5); // -6
println(5 << 1); // 10
println(5 >> 1); // 2
```

The bitwise and shift operators.

cards.title: The ternary operator
While
Do while
For
Loop
cards.body: %60%60%60rs%0Aloop%20%7B%0A%20%20println(%22Press%20Ctrl%2BC%20to%20stop%22)%3B%0A%7D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AThe%20unconditional%20%60loop%60.

cards.title: Break
Continue
Indexing%20a%20string
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Alet%20s%20%3D%20'Hello'%3B%0A%0Aprintln(s%5B0%5D)%3B%20%2F%2F%20H%0Aprintln(s%5B1%5D)%3B%20%2F%2F%20e%0Aprintln(s%5B4%5D)%3B%20%2F%2F%20o%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AIndexing%20a%20string%20returns%20a%201-character%20string.

cards.title: Concatening%20strings
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Alet%20greeting%20%3D%20'Hi'%20%2B%20'%20there!'%3B%0A%0Aprintln(greeting)%3B%0A%2F%2F%20Hi%20there!%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUse%20the%20%60%2B%60%20operator%20to%20concatenate%20strings.

cards.title: Indexing an array
cards.body:
```js
let a = [1, 2, 3];

println(a[0]); // 1
println(a[1]); // 2
println(a[2]); // 3
```

Indexing an array returns an element.

cards.title: Slicing an array
cards.body:
```js
let a = [1, 2, 3, 4];

println(a[0..2]);            // [1, 2, 3]
println(a[1..3]);            // [2, 3, 4]
println(a[2 .. len(a) - 1]); // [3, 4]
```

Arrays are zero-indexed.

cards.title: Appending an element
Element assignment
Concatening arrays
Subtracting arrays
Function declaration
Anonymous functions
Closures
Higher-order functions
Syntax sugar for functions
Recursion
Built-in%20functions
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Aprintln(type(5))%3B%0A%2F%2F%20number%0Aprintln('1'%20%2B%20to_string(2))%3B%0A%2F%2F%2012%0Aprintln(len('foo'))%3B%0A%2F%2F%203%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AThere%20are%20many%20built-in%20functions.

cards.title: More built-in functions
cards.body:
|             |           |             |
| ----------- | :-------- | :---------- |
| `print`     | `println` | `type`      |
| `is_nil`    | `is_bool` | `to_number` |
| `to_string` | `hex`     | `len`       |
| `exit`      | `assert`  | `panic`     |

See: [Built-in Functions](https://github.com/hook-lang/hook/blob/main/docs/built-in.md)

cards.title: Structs
Accessing fields
cards.body:
```js
println(p.x); // 5
println(p.y); // 10
```

Use `.` to access a field in a record.

cards.title: Field assignment
Destructuring an array
cards.body:
```js
let a = [1, 2];
let [x, y] = a;

println(x); // 1
println(y); // 2
```

Varuables are declared and assigned.

cards.title: Destructuring a record
Placeholder
Importing a module
Exporting%20symbols
cards.body: %60%60%60rs%0A%2F%2F%20my_module.hk%0Afn%20useful_fn()%20%7B%0A%20%20return%20%22Nothing%22%3B%0A%7D%0A%0Areturn%20%7B%20useful%3A%20useful_fn%20%7D%3B%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturn%20a%20record%20with%20the%20symbols%20to%20export.

cards.title: Importing%20local%20modules
cards.body: %60%60%60python%0Aimport%20%22.%2Fmy_module.hk%22%20as%20my%3B%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A%60%60%60js%0Aprintln(my.useful())%3B%0A%2F%2F%20Nothing%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ASpecify%20the%20path%20to%20the%20local%20module.

cards.title: Selective import
Core modules
cards.body:
|            |          |        |           |
| ---------- | :------- | :----- | :-------- |
| `math`     | `os`     | `io`   | `numbers` |
| `strings`  | `arrays` | `utf8` | `hashing` |
| `encoding` | `socket` | `json` | `lists`   |

See: [Core Modules](https://github.com/hook-lang/hook/blob/main/docs/core-modules.md)

cards.title: Extension modules
cards.body:
|           |           |         |           |
| --------- | :-------- | :------ | :-------- |
| `bigint`  | `crypto`  | `curl`  | `fastcgi` |
| `geohash` | `leveldb` | `mysql` | `redis`   |
| `regex`   | `sqlite`  | `uuid`  | `zeromq`  |

This is a list of extension modules.

cards.title: **io**%20module
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Aimport%20%7B%20stderr%2C%20writeln%20%7D%20from%20io%3B%0A%0Awriteln(stderr%2C%20%22Something%20went%20wrong%22)%3B%0A%2F%2F%20Something%20went%20wrong%0A%60%60%60%0A%0APrinting%20to%20%60stderr%60%20using%20%60io%60%20module.

cards.title: **hashing**%20module
cards.body: %60%60%60python%0Aimport%20hashing%20as%20h%3B%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A%60%60%60js%0Alet%20d%20%3D%20h.sha256('Hello%2C%20world!')%3B%0A%0Aprintln(hex(d))%3B%0A%2F%2F%20315f5bdb76d078c43b8ac0064e4a...%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A%60hashing%60%20module%20provides%20hash%20functions.

cards.title: **json**%20module
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Aimport%20json%3B%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A%60%60%60js%0Alet%20j%20%3D%20'%7B%22x%22%3A%201%2C%20%22y%22%3A%202%7D'%3B%0Alet%20p%20%3D%20json.decode(j)%3B%0A%0Aprintln(p.x)%3B%20%2F%2F%201%0A%0Alet%20k%20%3D%20json.encode(p)%3B%0Aprintln(type(k))%3B%20%2F%2F%20string%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUse%20%60json%60%20module%20for%20working%20with%20JSON.

cards.title: Errors
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Aprintln(to_int('foo'))%3B%0A%0A%2F%2F%20runtime%20error%3A%20type%20error%3A%20argument%20%231%20is%20not%20a%20convertible%20string%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20at%20to_int()%20in%20%3Cnative%3E%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20at%20main()%20in%20example.hk%3A1%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AHook%20uses%20panic%20mode%20for%20error%20handling.%20When%20an%20error%20occurs%2C%20the%20interpreter%20stops.

cards.title: Syntax%20error
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Aprintln('Hello%2C%20World!')%3B%0A%0A%2F%2F%20syntax%20error%3A%20unexpected%20end%20of%20file%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20at%20main()%20in%20example.hk%3A1%2C25%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AHook%20has%20a%20strict%20syntax.

cards.title: Panic
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Apanic('Something%20went%20wrong')%3B%0A%0A%2F%2F%20panic%3A%20Something%20went%20wrong%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20at%20main()%20in%20example.hk%3A1%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUse%20the%20%60panic%60%20built-in%20function%20to%20raise%20an%20error.

cards.title: Assert
cards.body: %60%60%60js%0Aassert(5%20%3E%2010%2C%20'5%20is%20not%20greater%20than%2010')%3B%0A%0A%2F%2F%20assert%3A%205%20is%20not%20greater%20than%2010%0A%2F%2F%20%20%20at%20main()%20in%20example.hk%3A1%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUse%20the%20%60assert%60%20built-in%20function%20to%20check%20a%20condition.

cards.title: Passing errors
